details.purpose: *To record the details about a bioreagent or laboratory consumable used as part of a diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in healthcare. (en)
details.misuse:
*Not to be used to record data about medicinal products that exert a direct pharmacological, metabolic or immunologic effect. For example: a medicine that requires a prescription should be recorded using the INSTRUCTION.medication_order archetype, focused on the active ingredients, dosage etc.
Not to be used to record data about medical devices, instruments or equipment used during diagnostic or therapeutic procedures - use the appropriate archetype for this purpose. (en)

details.purpose: *To record the details about a bioreagent or laboratory consumable used as part of a diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in healthcare. (en)
details.misuse:
*Not to be used to record data about medicinal products that exert a direct pharmacological, metabolic or immunologic effect. For example: a medicine that requires a prescription should be recorded using the INSTRUCTION.medication_order archetype, focused on the active ingredients, dosage etc.
Not to be used to record data about medical devices, instruments or equipment used during diagnostic or therapeutic procedures - use the appropriate archetype for this purpose. (en)

details.purpose: *To record the details about a bioreagent or laboratory consumable used as part of a diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in healthcare. (en)
details.misuse:
*Not to be used to record data about medicinal products that exert a direct pharmacological, metabolic or immunologic effect. For example: a medicine that requires a prescription should be recorded using the INSTRUCTION.medication_order archetype, focused on the active ingredients, dosage etc.
Not to be used to record data about medical devices, instruments or equipment used during diagnostic or therapeutic procedures - use the appropriate archetype for this purpose. (en)

details.purpose: For å registrere en detaljert oversikt over bioreagenser eller forbruksvarer anvendt ved en diagnostisk- eller behandlingsrettet prosedyre.
details.misuse:
Skal ikke brukes til å registrere data om legemidler som har en direkte farmakologisk, metabolsk eller immunologisk effekt. For eksempel: en medisin som krever resept skal registreres ved å bruke arketypen INSTRUCTION.medication_order (Legemiddelordinering), med fokus på de aktive ingrediensene, dosering osv.
Skal ikke brukes til å registrere data om medisinsk utstyr, instrumenter eller utstyr som brukes under diagnostiske eller terapeutiske prosedyrer - bruk riktig arketype for dette formålet.

details.purpose: *To record the details about a bioreagent or laboratory consumable used as part of a diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in healthcare. (en)
details.misuse:
*Not to be used to record data about medicinal products that exert a direct pharmacological, metabolic or immunologic effect. For example: a medicine that requires a prescription should be recorded using the INSTRUCTION.medication_order archetype, focused on the active ingredients, dosage etc.
Not to be used to record data about medical devices, instruments or equipment used during diagnostic or therapeutic procedures - use the appropriate archetype for this purpose. (en)

items.items: *A substance, compound, product or material used to identify or manipulate the chemical matter, or used to support the growth of cells or tissues, as part of a diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in healthcare. (en)
*For example: antibodies, immortalised cell lines, and tool compounds. (en)
*Identification of the reagent or consumable, preferably by a common name, a formal fully descriptive name or, if required, by class or category. (en)
*The category or type of reagent or consumable. (en)
*The number assigned by the manufacturer which identifies a group of items manufactured at the same time, usually found on the label or packaging material. (en)
*Date after which the device/product is no longer fit for use, usually found on the reagent itself or printed on the accompanying packaging. (en)
*Additional narrative about the bioreagent not captured in other fields. (en)
*A unique identifier allocated by a specified registry. (en)
*For example: Chemical Abstracts Service (CAS) number; Beilstein Registry number; or Enzyme Commission (EC) number. (en)
*The number assigned by the manufacturer, as it appears in the manufacturer's catalogue, labeling, or accompanying packaging. (en)

A substance, compound, product or material used to identify or manipulate the chemical matter, or used to support the growth of cells or tissues, as part of a diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in healthcare.
For example: antibodies, immortalised cell lines, and tool compounds.
Identification of the reagent or consumable, preferably by a common name, a formal fully descriptive name or, if required, by class or category.
The category or type of reagent or consumable.
The number assigned by the manufacturer which identifies a group of items manufactured at the same time, usually found on the label or packaging material.
Date after which the device/product is no longer fit for use, usually found on the reagent itself or printed on the accompanying packaging.
This date usually applies only to single use or disposable devices.
Additional narrative about the bioreagent not captured in other fields.
A unique identifier allocated by a specified registry.
For example: Chemical Abstracts Service (CAS) number; Beilstein Registry number; or Enzyme Commission (EC) number.
The number assigned by the manufacturer, as it appears in the manufacturer's catalogue, labeling, or accompanying packaging.

*A substance, compound, product or material used to identify or manipulate the chemical matter, or used to support the growth of cells or tissues, as part of a diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in healthcare. (en)
*For example: antibodies, immortalised cell lines, and tool compounds. (en)
*Identification of the reagent or consumable, preferably by a common name, a formal fully descriptive name or, if required, by class or category. (en)
*The category or type of reagent or consumable. (en)
*The number assigned by the manufacturer which identifies a group of items manufactured at the same time, usually found on the label or packaging material. (en)
*Date after which the device/product is no longer fit for use, usually found on the reagent itself or printed on the accompanying packaging. (en)
*Additional narrative about the bioreagent not captured in other fields. (en)
*A unique identifier allocated by a specified registry. (en)
*For example: Chemical Abstracts Service (CAS) number; Beilstein Registry number; or Enzyme Commission (EC) number. (en)
*The number assigned by the manufacturer, as it appears in the manufacturer's catalogue, labeling, or accompanying packaging. (en)

*A substance, compound, product or material used to identify or manipulate the chemical matter, or used to support the growth of cells or tissues, as part of a diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in healthcare. (en)
*For example: antibodies, immortalised cell lines, and tool compounds. (en)
*Identification of the reagent or consumable, preferably by a common name, a formal fully descriptive name or, if required, by class or category. (en)
*The category or type of reagent or consumable. (en)
*The number assigned by the manufacturer which identifies a group of items manufactured at the same time, usually found on the label or packaging material. (en)
*Date after which the device/product is no longer fit for use, usually found on the reagent itself or printed on the accompanying packaging. (en)
*This date usually applies only to single use or disposable devices.(en) Esta data geralmente se aplica apenas para dispositivos de uso único ou descartáveis.
*Additional narrative about the bioreagent not captured in other fields. (en)
*A unique identifier allocated by a specified registry. (en)
*For example: Chemical Abstracts Service (CAS) number; Beilstein Registry number; or Enzyme Commission (EC) number. (en)
*The number assigned by the manufacturer, as it appears in the manufacturer's catalogue, labeling, or accompanying packaging. (en)

Et substans/stoff, materiale eller sammensatt produkt som brukes til å identifisere eller manipulere det kjemiske stoffet, eller brukes til å støtte veksten av celler eller vev, som en del av en diagnostisk eller terapeutisk prosedyre i helsevesenet.
For eksempel: antistoff, cellelinjer, eller produkter.
Identifisering av reagens eller forbruksvare, fortrinnsvis ved vanlig navn, ved formelt, fullt beskrivende navn, eller hvis påkrevet, ved klasse eller kategori.
For eksempel: "Løsning for immobilisering av spermier".
Kategori eller type reagens eller forbruksvare.
Nummeret tildelt av produsenten som identifiserer en gruppe enheter som er produsert samtidig, som regel funnet på etiketten eller pakningsvedlegget.
Datoen produktet ikke lenger er egnet for bruk. Datoen finnes vanligvis på produktet eller på pakningsvedlegget.
Denne datoen gjelder vanligvis for engangsutstyr eller utstyr som ikke skal gjenbrukes.
Fritekstopplysninger om bioreagens som ikke er fanget opp i andre felter.
En unik identifikator tildelt av et spesifisert register.
For eksempel: Chemical Abstracts Service (CAS) nummer; Beilstein Registry nummer; eller Enzyme Commission (EC) nummer.
Nummer tildelt av produsenten, slik det framstår i produsentens katalog, merking eller medfølgende pakningsvedlegg.

*A substance, compound, product or material used to identify or manipulate the chemical matter, or used to support the growth of cells or tissues, as part of a diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in healthcare. (en)
*For example: antibodies, immortalised cell lines, and tool compounds. (en)
*Identification of the reagent or consumable, preferably by a common name, a formal fully descriptive name or, if required, by class or category. (en)
*The category or type of reagent or consumable. (en)
*The number assigned by the manufacturer which identifies a group of items manufactured at the same time, usually found on the label or packaging material. (en)
*Date after which the device/product is no longer fit for use, usually found on the reagent itself or printed on the accompanying packaging. (en)
Dieses Datum gilt normalerweise nur für Einmalprodukte oder Einwegprodukte.
*Additional narrative about the bioreagent not captured in other fields. (en)
*A unique identifier allocated by a specified registry. (en)
*For example: Chemical Abstracts Service (CAS) number; Beilstein Registry number; or Enzyme Commission (EC) number. (en)
*The number assigned by the manufacturer, as it appears in the manufacturer's catalogue, labeling, or accompanying packaging. (en)

*A substance, compound, product or material used to identify or manipulate the chemical matter, or used to support the growth of cells or tissues, as part of a diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in healthcare. (en)
*For example: antibodies, immortalised cell lines, and tool compounds. (en)
*Identification of the reagent or consumable, preferably by a common name, a formal fully descriptive name or, if required, by class or category. (en)
*The category or type of reagent or consumable. (en)
*The number assigned by the manufacturer which identifies a group of items manufactured at the same time, usually found on the label or packaging material. (en)
*Date after which the device/product is no longer fit for use, usually found on the reagent itself or printed on the accompanying packaging. (en)
Detta datum gäller vanligtvis utrustning som ska användas en gång.
*Additional narrative about the bioreagent not captured in other fields. (en)
*A unique identifier allocated by a specified registry. (en)
*For example: Chemical Abstracts Service (CAS) number; Beilstein Registry number; or Enzyme Commission (EC) number. (en)
*The number assigned by the manufacturer, as it appears in the manufacturer's catalogue, labeling, or accompanying packaging. (en)
